alert.note: Alert for Craighead; Crittenden; Cross (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 30 at 4:48PM CDT until further notice by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of East Arkansas, North Mississippi, Southeast Missouri and West Tennessee, including the following counties, in East Arkansas, Craighead, Crittenden, Cross, Lee, Mississippi, Phillips, Poinsett and St. Francis. In North Mississippi, Tunica. In Southeast Missouri, Dunklin and Pemiscot. In West Tennessee, Dyer, Lauderdale, Shelby and Tipton. * WHEN...Until 745 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 445 PM CDT, Heavy rain has fallen in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Emergency management reported that minor flooding is ongoing. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen and an additional inch is possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Memphis, Blytheville, Forrest City, Marion, Kennett, Wynne, Osceola, Trumann, Caruthersville, Marianna, Gosnell, Manila, Marked Tree, Earle, Steele, Lake City, Leachville, Lepanto, Bay and Senath. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
